text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response clearly outlines the three main jurisdictional tests applied in practice for admitting counterclaims in investor-state arbitration: consent, connection with the investor's claim, and applicable law. It then applies these tests conceptually to the scenario (BIT silent on counterclaims, UNCITRAL Rules apply) and offers a likelihood assessment by stating the tribunal will likely look at the connection and scope of submission. It also cites relevant leading cases (Saluka, CMS, Burlington) where tribunals accepted or declined counterclaims based on these principles.", "criterion_id": "335b696a-2d0f-4cb4-a3f2-fa19a617f230"}
